definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST
descriptionList: This message is sent by the source NG-RAN node to the target NG-RAN node to request the preparation of resources for a handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Target Cell Global ID
elementList.description: Includes either an E-UTRA CGI or an NR CGI

elementList.name: NG-C UE associated Signalling reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the AMF on the source NG-C connection.

elementList.name: Signalling TNL association address at source NG-C side
elementList.description: This IE indicates the AMF’s IP address of the SCTP association used at the source NG-C interface instance. NOTE: If no UE TNLA binding exists at the source NG-RAN node, the source NG-RAN node indicates the TNL association address it would have selected if it would have had to create a UE TNLA binding.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List
elementList.description: Similar to NG-C signalling, containing UL tunnel information per PDU Session Resource; and in addition, the source side QoS flow DRB mapping

elementList.name: RRC Context
elementList.description: Either includes the HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 10.2.2. of TS 36.331 [14], or the HandoverPreparationInformation-NB message as defined in subclause 10.6.2 of TS 36.331 [14], if the target NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, or the HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10], if the target NG-RAN node is a gNB.

elementList.name: Location Reporting Information
elementList.description: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting.

elementList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: LTE UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for LTE V2X services.

elementList.name: 5G ProSe UE PC5 Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.reference: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate 9.2.3.107
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for 5G ProSe services.

elementList.name: UE Slice Maximum Bit Rate List
NR A2X UE PC5 Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.reference: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate 9.2.3.107
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR A2X services.

elementList.name: LTE A2X UE PC5 Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.reference: LTE UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate 9.2.3.108
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for LTE A2X services.

elementList.name: UE Context Reference at the S-NG-RAN node
Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Conditional Handover Time Based Information
elementList.description: This IE only applies to NTN.

elementList.name: Handover Window Start
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the t1-Threshold contained in the ReportConfigNR IE as defined in TS 38.331 [10]

elementList.name: Handover Window Duration
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the duration contained in the condEventT1 contained in the ReportConfigNR IE as defined in TS 38.331 [10]

elementList.name: Maximum Number of Conditional Reconfigurations to Prepare
elementList.description: Indicates that the target NG-RAN node may prepare for CHO with candidate PSCell(s) configuration and indicates the maximum number of conditional reconfigurations that the target NG-RAN node may prepare.

elementList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: Mobility Information
elementList.description: Information related to the handover; the source NG-RAN node provides it in order to enable later analysis of the conditions that led to a wrong HO.

elementList.name: UE History Information from the UE
No PDU Session Indication
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is an IAB-MT.

elementList.name: 5G ProSe PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for 5G ProSe services.

elementList.name: IAB Authorization Status
elementList.description: This IE indicates the authorization status of the IAB node.

elementList.name: DL LBT Failure Information Request
elementList.description: This IE indicates that information on DL LBT Failures occurring at the target gNB that results in mobility failure is requested

elementList.name: A2X PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR A2X services.

elementList.name: Cell Based UE Trajectory Prediction
elementList.description: This IE contains information about cells that a UE is predicted to be connected to.

elementList.name: Source SN to Target SN QMC Information
elementList.description: This IE contains S-NG-RAN node-related QMC configuration information to be forwarded to the target S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Ranging and Sidelink Positioning Services Information
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services and/or 5G ProSe services.

rangeBoundList.explanation: PLMNs in the Management Based MDT PLMN list. Value is 16.

conditionList.explanation: This IE shall be present if the CHO Trigger IE is present and set to "CHO-replace".

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList: This message is sent by the target NG-RAN node to inform the source NG-RAN node about the prepared resources at the target.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node

elementList.name: PDU Session Resources Admitted List
elementList.description: Ignored, if the CHO-CPAC Configuration Indicator IE is included within the CHO-CPAC Information IE and set to "cho-only-not-prepared".

elementList.name: PDU Session Resources Not Admitted List
Target NG-RAN node To Source NG-RAN node Transparent Container
elementList.description: Either includes the HandoverCommand message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [14], if the target NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, or the HandoverCommand message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10], if the target NG-RAN node is a gNB. Ignored if the CHO-CPAC Configuration Indicator IE is included within the CHO-CPAC Information IE and set to "cho-only-not-prepared".

elementList.name: DRBs transferred to MN
elementList.description: In case of DC, indicates that SN Status is needed for the listed DRBs from the S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Requested Target Cell ID
elementList.description: Target cell indicated in the corresponding HANDOVER REQUEST message

definitionList.name: HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE
descriptionList: This message is sent by the target NG-RAN node to inform the source NG-RAN node that the Handover Preparation has failed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Requested Target Cell ID
elementList.description: Target cell indicated in the corresponding HANDOVER REQUEST message

definitionList.name: SN STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList: This message is sent by the source NG-RAN node to the target NG-RAN node to transfer the uplink/downlink PDCP SN. HFN status and MRO related information during a handover or for dual connectivity.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node target NG-RAN node(handover), NG-RAN node from which the DRB context is transferred NG-RAN node to which the DRB context is transferred (RRC connection re-establishment or dual connectivity).

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source NG-RAN node and for dual connectivity at the NG-RAN node from which the DRB context is transferred.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target NG-RAN node and for dual connectivity at the NG-RAN node to which the DRB context is transferred.

elementList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer List

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE
descriptionList: This message is sent by the target NG-RAN node to the source NG-RAN node to indicate that resources can be released.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node source NG-RAN node, M-NG-RAN node S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source NG-RAN node or for dual connectivity at the S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target NG-RAN node or for dual connectivity at the M-NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER CANCEL
descriptionList: This message is sent by the source NG-RAN node to the target NG-RAN node to cancel an ongoing handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Candidate Cells To Be Cancelled List

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be prepared for a conditional handover. Value is 8.

definitionList.name: RAN PAGING
descriptionList: This message is sent by the NG-RAN node1 to NG-RAN node2 to page a UE.

elementList.name: Index Length-10
elementList.description: Coded as specified in TS 38.304 [33] and TS 36.304 [34].

elementList.name: Paging DRX
elementList.description: Includes the RAN paging cycle as defined in TS 36.304 [34] and 38.304 [33].

elementList.name: Extended UE Identity Index Value
elementList.description: Coded as specified in TS 36.304 [34] and 38.304 [33].

elementList.name: UE Specific DRX
elementList.description: Includes the UE specific paging cycle as defined in TS 36.304 [34] and 38.304 [33].

elementList.name: NR Paging eDRX Information for RRC INACTIVE
NR Paging Long eDRX Information for RRC INACTIVE

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT REQUEST
descriptionList: This message is sent by the new NG-RAN node to request the old NG-RAN node to transfer the UE Context to the new NG-RAN.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new NG-RAN node old NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Integrity protection
elementList.description: RRC Resume: Corresponds to information provided either in the resumeMAC-I either contained in the RRCResumeRequest or the RRCResumeRequest1 message as defined in TS 38.331 [10]) or in the shortResumeMAC-I in the RRCConnectionResumeRequest message as defined in TS 36.331 [14]) RRC Reestablishment: Corresponds to information provided either in the shortMAC-I contained in the RRCReestablishmentRequest message as defined in TS 38.331 [10]) or in the shortMAC-I in the RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message as defined in TS 36.331 [14]). RRC Resume for UP CIoT Optimization: Corresponds to information provided in the shortResumeMAC-I in the RRCConnectionResumeRequest message or the RRCConnectionResumeRequest-NB message as defined in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: New Cell Identifier
elementList.description: RRC Resume: Corresponds to information provided either in the targetCellIdentity within the VarResumeMAC-Input as specified in TS 38.331 [10] or in the cellIdentity within the VarShortINACTIVE-MAC-Input as specified in TS 36.331 [14]. RRC Reestablishment: Corresponds to information provided in the targetCellIdentity within the VarShortMAC-Input as specified in TS 38.331 [10] or in the cellIdentity within the VarShortMAC-Input as specified in TS 36.331 [14]. RRC Resume for UP CIoT Optimization: Corresponds to information provided either in the cellIdentity within the VarShortResumeMAC-Input or the VarShortResumeMAC-Input-NB as specified in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: RRC Resume Cause
elementList.description: In case of RNA Update, contains information provided in the resumeCause by the UE in the RRCResumeRequest or the RRCResumeRequest1 message, as defined in TS 38.331 [10], or information provided in the resumeCause-r15 in the RRCConnectionResumeRequest message, as defined in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: SRS Positioning Configuration Or Activation Request

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE
descriptionList: This message is sent by the old NG-RAN node to transfer the UE context to the new NG-RAN node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: old NG-RAN node new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the old NG-RAN node

elementList.name: UE Context Information – Retrieve UE Context Response
Location Reporting Information
elementList.description: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting.

elementList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: UE History Information from the UE
UE Context Reference at the S-NG-RAN node
5G ProSe PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for 5G ProSe services.

elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR A2X services.

elementList.name: Ranging and Sidelink Positioning Services Information

rangeBoundList.explanation: PLMNs in the Management Based MDT PLMN list. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT FAILURE
descriptionList: This message is sent by the old NG-RAN node to inform the new NG-RAN node that the Retrieve UE Context procedure has failed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: old NG-RAN node new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node To New NG-RAN node Resume Container
elementList.description: Includes either the RRCRelease message as defined in TS 38.331 [10], or the RRCConnectionRelease message as defined in TS 36.331 [14], encapsulated in a PDCP-C PDU.

definitionList.name: XN-U ADDRESS INDICATION
descriptionList: This message is either sent by the new NG-RAN node to transfer data forwarding information to the old NG-RAN node, or by the M-NG-RAN node to provide either data forwarding or Xn-U bearer address related information for SN terminated bearers to the S-NG-RAN node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new NG-RAN node old NG-RAN node, M-NG-RAN node S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node or at the M-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the old NG-RAN node or at the S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Xn-U Address Information per PDU Session Resources List
elementList.description: This IE is ignored if the CHO DC Indicator IE is included and set to "coordination-only", or if the CPC Data Forwarding indicator IE is included and set to "coordination-only", or if the MBS Data Forwarding Indicator IE is included and set to "MBS-only".

elementList.name: Xn-U Address Information per PDU Session Resources Item
Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node
PDU Session Resource Setup Complete Info – SN terminated
Secondary Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node List
elementList.description: This IE would be present only when the target M-NG-RAN node decide to split a PDU session between MN and SN

elementList.name: DRB IDs taken into use
elementList.description: Indicating the DRB IDs taken into use by the target NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8].

elementList.name: Data Forwarding Info from target E-UTRAN node
CHO MR-DC Indicator
elementList.description: Indicating that the XN-U ADDRESS INDICATION message is for Conditional Handover, as specified in TS 37.340 [8].

elementList.name: CHO MR-DC Early Data Forwarding Indicator
CPC Data Forwarding indicator
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (triggered, early data transmission stop, ..., coordination-only)
elementList.description: Indicating that the XN-U ADDRESS INDICATION message is for a Conditional PSCell Change.

elementList.name: MBS Data Forwarding Indicator
elementList.description: Indicating that the XN-U ADDRESS INDICATION message is for MBS session data forwarding.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of PDU sessions. Value is 256

definitionList.name: HANDOVER SUCCESS

definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Requested Target Cell ID
elementList.description: Target cell indicated in the corresponding Handover Preparation procedure

definitionList.name: CONDITIONAL HANDOVER CANCEL

definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Candidate Cells To Be Cancelled List
Conditional Reconfigurations To Be Cancelled List

Target PSCell ID

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be prepared for a conditional handover. Value is 8.

Maximum no. conditional reconfigurations that the UE can store. Value is 8.
The total of maxnoofCellsinCHO and maxnoofPSCellCandidates should not exceed 8.

definitionList.name: EARLY STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList: This message is sent by the source NG-RAN node to the target NG-RAN node to transfer the COUNT value related to the forwarded downlink SDUs during DAPS Handover or Conditional Handover.

For MR-DC with 5GC, the message is also used, during a Conditional Handover, to transfer from the source S-NG-RAN node to the source M-NG-RAN node, the COUNT value related to the forwarded downlink SDUs.

For MR-DC with NG SCG, this message is also used, during a CPAC, to transfer from the source S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node, and from the M-NG-RAN node to the target S-NG-RAN node, the COUNT value related to the forwarded downlink SDUs.
definitionList.direction: Direction: M-NG-RAN node target S-NG-RAN node (Conditional PSCell Change).

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: DRBs Subject To Early Status Transfer List
DRBs Subject To Early Status Transfer Item
FIRST DL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12 9.2.3.36
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number of the first DL SDU forwarded to the receiving NG-RAN node in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: FIRST DL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.3.37
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number of the first DL SDU forwarded to the receiving NG-RAN node in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DRBs Subject To DL Discarding List
DRBs Subject To DL Discarding Item
DISCARD DL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12 9.2.3.36
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number for which the receiving NG-RAN node should discard forwarded DL SDUs associated with lower values in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DISCARD DL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.3.37
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number for which the receiving NG-RAN node should discard forwarded DL SDUs associated with lower values in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of DRBs allowed towards one UE. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: RAN MULTICAST GROUP PAGING
descriptionList: This message is sent by the NG-RAN node1 to NG-RAN node2 to page UEs for a multicast session.

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT CONFIRM
descriptionList: This message is sent by the new NG-RAN node to the old NG-RAN node to inform the old NG-RAN node whether the S-NG-RAN node associated with the old NG-RAN node for the UE that was indicated during UE context retrieval is kept or not by the new NG-RAN node during RRC resumption.
In case of RACH based SDT without UE context relocation, the Retrieve UE Context Confirm procedure is also used to request termination of SDT session from the new NG-RAN node to the old NG-RAN node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new NG-RAN node old NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the old NG-RAN node

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: SDT Termination Request
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (radio link problem, normal, …, Large SDT volume from BSR)
elementList.description: Indicate the reason of request for termination of an ongoing SDT session.

definitionList.name: RRC TRANSFER
descriptionList: This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN-NODE to the S-NG-RAN-NODE to transfer an RRC message or from the S-NG-RAN-NODE to the M-NG-RAN-NODE to report the DL RRC message delivery status.

This message is also sent by the new NG-RAN-NODE to the old NG-RAN-NODE or from the old NG-RAN-NODE to the new NG-RAN-NODE to transfer an RRC message containing the SDT SRB in case of RACH based SDT without UE context relocation.

This message is also sent by the M-NG-RAN node to the S-NG-RAN node or from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node to forward QoE measurement results and/or the RAN visible QoE measurement results received from the UE.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new NG-RAN node old NG-RAN node or old NG-RAN node new NG-RAN node (SDT).

elementList.name: M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node or at the new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node or at the old NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: RRC Container
elementList.description: Contains a PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] or TS 36.331 [14] and ciphered with the key of the M-NG-RAN node

elementList.name: SRB Type
elementList.description: The SRB type to be used

elementList.name: Delivery Status
elementList.description: DL RRC delivery status of split SRB

elementList.name: RRC Container
elementList.description: For NGEN-DC and NR-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] containing the MeasurementReport message or the RRCReconfigurationComplete message or the FailureInformation message or the UEAssistanceInformation message. For NR-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] containing the IABOtherInformation message. For NE-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 36.331 [14] containing the MeasurementReport message.

elementList.name: Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN
RRC Container
elementList.description: For NR-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] containing the MCGFailureInformation, message. For NGEN-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 36.331 [14] containing the MCGFailureInformation message.

elementList.name: Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN

elementList.description: For NR-DC, includes the DL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] containing the RRCReconfiguration message, or the RRCRelease message, or the MobilityFromNRCommand message. For NGEN-DC, includes the DL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 36.331 [14] containing the RRCConnectionReconfiguration message, or the RRCConnectionRelease message, or the MobilityFromEUTRACommand message.

elementList.name: SDT SRB between New NG-RAN node and Old NG-RAN node

elementList.description: Contains a PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.description: In this version of the specification, values "0", "1", "3", "4" and "5" are not set by the sender and ignored by the receiver.

definitionList.name: ERROR INDICATION
descriptionList: This message is used to indicate that some error has been detected in the NG-RAN node.

elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source NG-RAN node and for dual connectivity at the S-NG-RAN node or for an SN Status Transfer procedure at the NG-RAN node from which a DRB is offloaded.

definitionList.name: XN REMOVAL REQUEST
descriptionList: This message is sent by a NG-RAN node to a neighbouring NG-RAN node to initiate the removal of the interface instance.

definitionList.name: XN REMOVAL RESPONSE
descriptionList: This message is sent by a NG-RAN node to a neighbouring NG-RAN node to acknowledge the initiation of removal of the interface instance.

definitionList.name: XN REMOVAL FAILURE
descriptionList: This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to indicate that removing the interface instance cannot be accepted.

definitionList.name: FAILURE INDICATION
descriptionList: This message is sent by NG-RAN node2 to indicate an RRC re-establishment attempt or a reception of an RLF Report from a UE that suffered a connection failure at NG-RAN node1.

Failure cell PCI

elementList.name: C-RNTI
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the c-RNTI contained either in the RRCReestablishmentRequest message (TS 38.331 [10]) or in the RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message (TS 36.331 [14])

elementList.name: ShortMAC-I
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the shortMAC-I contained either in the RRCReestablishmentRequest message (TS 38.331 [10]) or in the RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message (TS 36.331 [14])

elementList.name: RRC Conn Reestab Indicator
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the reestablishmentCause contained in the RRCReestablishmentRequest message as defined in TS 38.331 [10] or in the RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message as defined in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: RRC Reestab Reporting with RLF Report
RRC Setup Reporting with RLF Report
UE RLF Report Container
elementList.description: This IE is not used in this version of the specification.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REPORT
descriptionList: This message is sent by NG-RAN node1 to NG-RAN node2 to report a handover failure event, or other critical mobility problem.

elementList.name: Handover Report Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (HO too early, HO to wrong cell, Inter-system ping-pong. …)

elementList.name: Handover Cause
elementList.description: Indicates handover cause employed for handover from NG-RAN node 2

elementList.name: Source cell CGI
elementList.description: NG-RAN CGI of source cell for handover procedure (in NG-RAN node 2)

elementList.name: Target cell CGI
elementList.description: NG-RAN CGI of target cell for handover procedure (in NG-RAN node 1). If the Handover Report Type is set to “Inter-system ping-pong”, it contains the target cell of the inter system handover from the other system to NG-RAN node 1 cell

elementList.name: Re-establishment cell CGI
elementList.description: CGI of cell where UE attempted re-establishment or where UE successfully re- connected after the failure

elementList.name: Target cell in E-UTRAN
elementList.description: Encoded according to Global Cell ID in the Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information IE, as defined in TS 36.413 [31]

elementList.name: Source cell C-RNTI
elementList.description: C-RNTI allocated at the source NG-RAN node (in NG-RAN node 2)

elementList.name: Mobility Information
elementList.description: Information provided in the HANDOVER REQUEST message or in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message from NG-RAN node 2.

elementList.name: UE RLF Report Container
elementList.description: The UE RLF Report Container IE received in the FAILURE INDICATION message.

elementList.name: Target cell C-RNTI
elementList.description: C-RNTI allocated at the target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Time Since Failure
elementList.description: Corresponds to the TimeSinceFailure IE received from the UE in RLF Report as defined in TS 36.331 [14].

conditionList.explanation: This IE shall be present if the Handover Report Type IE is set to the value "HO to wrong cell"
This IE shall be present if the Handover Report Type IE is set to the value "Inter-system ping-pong"

definitionList.name: RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST
descriptionList: This message is sent by NG-RAN node1 to NG-RAN node2 to initiate the requested measurement according to the parameters given in the message.

elementList.description: Allocated by NG-RAN node1

elementList.name: NG-RAN node2 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by NG-RAN node2

elementList.description: Type of request for which the resource status is required.

elementList.name: Report Characteristics
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap indicates measurement object the NG-RAN node2 is requested to report. First Bit = PRB Periodic, Second Bit = TNL Capacity Ind Periodic, Third Bit = Composite Available Capacity Periodic, Fourth Bit =Number of Active UEs Periodic, Fifth Bit =RRC connections Periodic, Sixth Bit = NR-U Channel List Periodic. Other bits shall be ignored by the NG-RAN node2.

elementList.name: Cell To Report List
elementList.description: Cell ID list to which the request applies.

elementList.name: SSB To Report List

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMN

elementList.name: Reporting Periodicity
elementList.description: Periodicity that can be used for reporting of indicated measurements. Also used as the averaging window length for all measurement object if supported. This IE is ignored if the Registration Request IE is set to "add".

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be served by a NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.
Maximum no. SSB Areas that can be served by a NG-RAN node cell. Value is 64.
Maximum no. of signalled slice support items. Value is 1024.

conditionList.explanation: This IE shall be present if the Registration Request IE is set to the value "stop" or "add".
This IE shall be present if the Registration Request IE is set to the value "start".

definitionList.name: RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE
descriptionList: This message is sent by NG-RAN node2 to NG-RAN node1 to report the results of the requested measurements.

elementList.name: NG-RAN node1 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by NG-RAN node1

elementList.name: NG-RAN node2 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by NG-RAN node2

elementList.name: NR-U Channel ID
elementList.description: The NR-U channel utilised in the last reporting period

elementList.name: Channel occupancy time percentage DL
elementList.description: The percentage of time for which the channel resources have been utilised for DL traffic served by the corresponding NR-U Channel of the serving cell. Value 100 indicates that the channel resources have been utilized for DL traffic served by the corresponding NR-U Channel of the serving cell for the whole duration between consecutive reporting.

elementList.name: Energy Detection Threshold DL
elementList.description: Average ED Threshold used for DL channel sensing at the gNB. Value is in dBm.

elementList.name: Channel Occupancy Time Percentage UL
elementList.description: The percentage of time for which the channel resources have been utilised for UL traffic served by the corresponding NR-U Channel of the serving cell for UEs that transmit to the serving cell. Value 100 indicates that the channel resources have been utilized for UL traffic served by the corresponding NR-U Channel of the serving cell for the whole duration between consecutive reporting.

elementList.name: Energy Detection Threshold UL
elementList.description: Indicates the average of the maximum ED Threshold configured by the gNB for UL channel sensing. Value is in dBm.

elementList.name: Radio Resource Status NR-U
elementList.description: Indicates the radio resource status per NR-U channel.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be served by a NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.
Maximum no. NR-U channel IDs in a cell. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: DATA COLLECTION REQUEST
descriptionList: This message is sent by NG-RAN node1 to NG-RAN node2 to initiate the requested information reporting according to the parameters given in the message.

elementList.name: NG-RAN node1 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by NG-RAN node1

elementList.name: NG-RAN node2 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by NG-RAN node2

elementList.name: Registration Request for Data Collection
elementList.description: Type of request for which the information is required.

elementList.name: Report Characteristics for Data Collection
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap indicates the object the NG-RAN node2 is requested to report. First Bit = Predicted Radio Resource Status, Second Bit = Predicted Number of Active UEs, Third Bit = Predicted RRC Connections Fourth Bit = Average UE Throughput DL, Fifth Bit = Average UE Throughput UL, Sixth Bit = Average Packet Delay, Seventh Bit = Average Packet Loss DL Eighth Bit = Energy Cost Ninth Bit = Measured UE Trajectory Other bits are ignored by the NG-RAN node2.

elementList.name: Cell To Report List for Data Collection
elementList.description: Cell ID list to which the request applies.

elementList.name: Cell To Report Item for Data Collection
Cell ID
elementList.description: Indicates an NR Cell Identity.

elementList.name: Reporting Periodicity for Data Collection
elementList.description: Periodicity that can be used for reporting of requested objects. Also used as the averaging window length for all objects if supported.

elementList.name: Requested Prediction Time
elementList.description: For one time reporting, it indicates the point in time, measured from reception of the DATA COLLECTION REQUEST message, for which predictions are provided. In periodic reporting, for each subsequent DATA COLLECTION UPDATE message, the point in time is shifted by the reporting periodicity. (unit: second)

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be served by a NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.

conditionList.explanation: This IE shall be present if the Registration Request for Data Collection IE is set to the value “stop”.
This IE shall be present if the Registration Request for Data Collection IE is set to the value “start”.

Other bits are ignored by the NG-RAN node1.

definitionList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer List
descriptionList: This IE contains a list of DRBs containing information about PDCP SN status.

elementList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer Item
Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 12-bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12 9.2.3.36
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 12-bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 18-bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.3.37
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 18-bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: This IE is not used in this version of the specification.

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12 9.2.3.36
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target NG-RAN node (handover) or the NG-RAN node to which the DRB context is transferred (dual connectivity) should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 12-bit long PDCP-SN.

elementList.name: Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: This IE is not used in this version of the specification.

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value

In this version of the specification, the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE is not included by the sending node and ignored if received in the Old QoS Flow List - UL End Marker expected IE.

definitionList.name: Global gNB ID
descriptionList: This IE is used to globally identify a gNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: gNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.

definitionList.name: Global ng-eNB ID
descriptionList: This IE is used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: Short Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: Long Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: Global NG-RAN Node ID
descriptionList: This IE is used to globally identify an NG-RAN node (see TS 38.300 [9]).

definitionList.name: PLMN Identity
descriptionList: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity.

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

definitionList.name: TAC
descriptionList: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

definitionList.name: RAN Area Code
descriptionList: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

definitionList.name: NR CGI
descriptionList: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

definitionList.name: E-UTRA CGI
descriptionList: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

elementList.name: E-UTRA Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

definitionList.name: NG-RAN Cell Identity
descriptionList: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

elementList.name: E-UTRA Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

elementList.name: DL Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the DL Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.description: Contains FDD UL resource configuration of gNB-DU’s cell. Only applicable if the gNB-DU is an IAB-DU or an IAB-donor-DU.

elementList.name: gNB-DU Cell Resource Configuration-FDD-DL
elementList.description: Contains FDD DL resource configuration of gNB-DU’s cell. Only applicable if the gNB-DU is an IAB-DU or an IAB-donor-DU.

elementList.name: Transmission Bandwidth
elementList.description: This IE is ignored if the Transmission Bandwidth asymmetric IE is present.

elementList.name: TDD UL-DL Configuration Common NR
elementList.description: Includes the tdd-UL-DL-ConfigurationCommon contained in the SIB1 message as defined in TS 38.331 [10]

elementList.name: Carrier List

elementList.name: gNB-DU Cell Resource Configuration-TDD
elementList.description: Contains TDD resource configuration of gNB-DU’s cell. Only applicable if the gNB-DU is an IAB-DU or an IAB-donor-DU.

elementList.name: Transmission Bandwidth asymmetric
elementList.description: Indicates the asymmetric UL and DL transmission bandwidth.

elementList.name: Measurement Timing Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the served cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR
elementList.description: This IE corresponds to information provided in the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE and the NPN-IdentityInfoList IE (if available) in SIB1 as specified in TS 38.331 [10]. All PLMN Identities and associated information contained in the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE and NPN identities and associated information contained in the NPN-IdentityInfoList IE (if available) are included and provided in the same order as broadcast in the SIB1 message. NOTE: In case of NPN-only cell, the PLMN Identities and associated information contained in the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE are not included.

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMNs in the SIB1 message, associated to the NR Cell Identity IE.

elementList.name: Configured TAC Indication
elementList.description: NOTE: This IE is associated with the TAC in the Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR IE

elementList.name: NPN Broadcast Information
elementList.description: If this IE is included the content of the Broadcast PLMNs IE in the Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR IE is ignored.

elementList.name: Configured TAC Indication
elementList.description: NOTE: This IE is associated with the TAC on top-level of the Served Cell Information NR IE

elementList.name: NPN Broadcast Information
elementList.description: If this IE is included the content of the Broadcast PLMNs IE in the top Served Cell Information NR IE is ignored.

elementList.name: NR Cell PRACH Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the NR Cell PRACH Configuration IE as defined in section 9.3.1.139 in TS 38.473 [41].

elementList.name: CSI-RS Transmission Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates the CSI-RS transmission status of the given cell. If the Additional Measurement Timing Configuration List IE is present, this IE is ignored.

elementList.name: Supported MBS FSA ID List
elementList.description: Shall contain all MBS Frequency Selection Area Identities associated to the NR Cell Identity in the NR CGI IE.

elementList.name: MBS Frequency Selection Area Identity
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the MBS-FSAI IE as defined in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: NR-U Channel ID
elementList.description: Index to uniquely identify the part of the NR-U Channel Bandwidth consisting of a contiguous set of resource blocks (RBs) on which a channel access procedure is performed in shared spectrum. Value 1 represents the first part of the NR-U Channel Bandwidth on which a channel access procedure is performed. Value 2 represents the second part of the NR-U Channel Bandwidth on which a channel access procedure is performed, and so on.

elementList.name: NR ARFCN
elementList.description: It represents the centre frequency of the NR-U Channel Bandwidth for NR bands restricted to operation with shared spectrum channel access, as defined in TS 37.213 [51]. Allowed values are specified in 38.101-1 [52] in Table 5.4.2.3-2, Table 5.4.2.3-3 and Table 5.4.2.3-4.

elementList.name: Measurement Timing Configuration Index
elementList.description: “0” refers to the configuration contained in the Measurement Timing Configuration IE. Any value between “1” and “16” refers to a configuration within the Additional Measurement Timing Configuration List IE.

elementList.name: CSI- RS MTC Configuration List
elementList.description: This list explicitly expresses the CSI-RS configurations contained in the MTC

elementList.name: CSI-RS Index
elementList.description: Index of CSI-RS as in MTC

elementList.name: CSI-RS Status
elementList.description: This IE indicates the CSI-RS transmission status of the configuration.

elementList.name: CSI-RS Neighbour List
elementList.description: This list expresses the cells and CSI-RSs neighbouring the CSI-RS in the CSI-RS Index IE.

elementList.name: CSI-RS MTC Neighbour List
elementList.description: This list expresses the CSI-RSs served by the NR CGI, which are neighbouring the CSI-RS of the served cell and contained in the MTC indicated by the neighbouring NR cell.

elementList.name: RedCap Broadcast Information
elementList.description: The presence of this IE indicates that the intraFreqReselectionRedCap is broadcast in the SIB1 message of the corresponding cell, see TS 38.331 [10]. Each position in the bitmap indicates which RedCap UEs are allowed access, according to the setting of RedCap barring indicators in the SIB1 message, see TS 38.331 [10]. First bit = 1Rx, second bit = 2Rx, third bit = halfDuplex, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates 'access allowed'. Value '0' indicates 'access not allowed”.

elementList.name: eRedCap Broadcast Information
elementList.description: The presence of this IE indicates that the intraFreqReselection-eRedCap IE is broadcast in SIB1 of the corresponding cell, see TS 38.331 [10]. Each position in the bitmap indicates which eRedCap UEs are allowed access, according to the setting of the barring indicators in SIB1, see TS 38.331 [10]. First bit = 1Rx, second bit = 2Rx, third bit = half-duplex, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates 'access allowed'. Value '0' indicates 'access not allowed'.

elementList.name: XR Broadcast Information
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the cellBarred2RxXR contained in the SIB1 message as defined in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: Barring Exemption for Emergency Call Information
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the barringExemptEmergencyCall contained in the SIB1 message as defined in 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: E-UTRA PCI

elementList.name: EARFCN
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of neighbour cells associated to a given served cell. Value is 1024.

elementList.name: Served Cells To Modify NR

elementList.description: List of deleted cells served by the NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: Served Cells to Update E-UTRA
descriptionList: This IE contains updated configuration information for served E-UTRA cells exchanged between NG-RAN nodes.

elementList.name: Served Cells To Add E-UTRA
elementList.description: List of added cells served by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: SFN Offset
elementList.description: Associated with the ECGI IE in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE

elementList.name: Served Cells To Modify E-UTRA
elementList.description: List of modified cells served by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Deactivation Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that the concerned cell is switched off for energy saving reasons.

elementList.name: SFN Offset
elementList.description: Associated with the ECGI IE in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE

elementList.name: Served Cells To Delete E-UTRA
elementList.description: List of deleted cells served by the NG-RAN node.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be served by a NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.

definitionList.name: Cell Assistance Information NR
descriptionList: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about NR cells.

elementList.name: List of Requested NR Cells
elementList.description: Included when the NG-RAN node requests a limited list of served NR cells.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested.

elementList.name: Complete Information Request Indicator
elementList.description: Included when the NG-RAN node requests the complete list of served cells for a gNB

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be served by a NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.

definitionList.name: SUL Information
descriptionList: This IE contains information about the SUL carrier.

elementList.name: SUL Frequency Info
elementList.description: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

elementList.name: Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the SUL Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: Frequency Shift 7p5khz
elementList.description: Indicate whether the value of Δshift is 0kHz or 7.5kHz when calculating FREF,shift as defined in Section 5.4.2.1 of TS 38.104 [24].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of NRARFCNs. Value is 3279165.

definitionList.name: NR Frequency Info
descriptionList: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD or for SUL carrier.

elementList.name: NR ARFCN
elementList.description: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

elementList.name: NR Frequency Band
elementList.description: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

elementList.name: Supported SUL band Item
elementList.description: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.

elementList.name: Frequency Shift 7p5khz
elementList.description: Indicate whether the value of Δshift is 0kHz or 7.5kHz when calculating FREF,shift as defined in Section 5.4.2.1 of TS 38.104 [24].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of NRARFCNs. Value is 3279165.
Maximum no. of frequency bands supported for a NR cell. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: NR Transmission Bandwidth
descriptionList: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.

elementList.name: NR SCS
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (scs15, scs30, scs60, scs120, …, scs480, scs960)
elementList.description: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

elementList.name: NR NRB
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ..., nrb33, nrb62, nrb124, nrb148, nrb248, nrb44, nrb58, nrb92, nrb119, nrb188, nrb242, nrb15)
elementList.description: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [24]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 11, 18, etc.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA ARFCN
descriptionList: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in an E-UTRAN cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

elementList.name: E-UTRA ARFCN
elementList.description: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [25].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of EARFCNs. Value is 262143.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA Transmission Bandwidth
descriptionList: The E-UTRA Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 36.104 [25]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

elementList.name: E-UTRA Transmission Bandwidth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100,... , bw1)

definitionList.name: Number of Antenna Ports E-UTRA
descriptionList: The Number of Antenna Ports E-UTRA IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports supported by an E-UTRA cell.

elementList.name: Number of Antenna Ports
elementList.description: an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports

definitionList.name: E-UTRA Multiband Info List
descriptionList: The E-UTRA Multiband Info List IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that an E-UTRA cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference and corresponds to information provided in the MultiBandInfoList IE specified in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Frequency Band Indicator
elementList.description: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [27, table 5.5-1]

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum number of frequency bands that an E-UTRA cell belongs to. The value is 16.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA PRACH Configuration
descriptionList: This IE indicates the E-UTRA PRACH resources used in an E-UTRA neighbour cell.

elementList.name: RootSequenceIndex
elementList.description: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration
elementList.description: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: HighSpeedFlag
elementList.description: "true" corresponds to Restricted set and "false" to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: PRACH-FrequencyOffset
elementList.description: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: PRACH-ConfigurationIndex
elementList.description: See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [26]

conditionList.explanation: This IE shall be present if the EUTRA-Mode-Info IE in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE is set to the value "TDD".

definitionList.name: MBSFN Subframe Allocation E-UTRA
descriptionList: The MBSFN Subframe Allocation E-UTRA IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as specified for the MBSFN-SubframeConfig IE TS 36.331 [14].

definitionList.name: Global NG-RAN Cell Identity
descriptionList: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.

definitionList.name: Connectivity Support
descriptionList: The Connectivity Support IE is used to indicate the connectivity supported by a NR cell.

definitionList.name: Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication
descriptionList: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA – NR Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Activation SFN
elementList.description: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

elementList.name: Protected Resource List
elementList.description: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.

elementList.name: Protected Resource List Item
elementList.description: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.

elementList.name: Resource Type
elementList.description: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

elementList.name: Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint
elementList.description: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value "0" indicates "resource not protected", value "1" indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs. is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern
elementList.description: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Time Pattern
elementList.description: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Time-periodicity
elementList.description: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Start Time
elementList.description: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.

elementList.name: MBSFN Control Region Length
elementList.description: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

elementList.name: PDCCH Region Length
elementList.description: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. protected resource patterns. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
descriptionList: This IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Activation SFN
elementList.description: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

elementList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
elementList.description: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold.

definitionList.name: Data Traffic Resources
descriptionList: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Data Traffic Resources
elementList.description: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of or , defined in TS 36.211 [26].

definitionList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
descriptionList: The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.

elementList.name: Subframe Type
elementList.description: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

elementList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates "regular subframe". Value ‘1’ indicates "reserved subframe". For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: MBSFN Control Region Length
elementList.description: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

definitionList.name: MR-DC Resource Coordination Information
descriptionList: The MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE is used to coordinate resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: CHOICE NG-RAN Node Resource Coordination Information
E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information
elementList.description: E-UTRA resource coordination information

elementList.name: NR Resource Coordination Information
elementList.description: NR resource coordination information

definitionList.name: E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information
descriptionList: The E-UTRA Resource Configuration Information IE indicates LTE resource allocation at ng-eNB used at the gNB to coordinate resource or sidelink resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN-node and S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: EUTRA Cell ID
elementList.description: This IE indicates the SpCell.

elementList.name: UL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes or SL subframes for sidelink transmission. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: DL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: This IE indicates the assumed SpCell.

definitionList.name: NR Resource Coordination Information
descriptionList: The NR Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the ng-eNB SpCell which are not available for use by the ng-eNB and is used at the ng-eNB to coordinate resource or sidelink resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: This IE indicates the SpCell.

elementList.name: UL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "SpCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "SpCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes or SL subframes for sidelink transmission. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: DL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "SpCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "SpCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: EUTRA Cell ID
elementList.description: Reference cell for UL Coordination Information IE and DL Coordination Information IE.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information
descriptionList: The E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the ng-eNB and used by the gNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: NR Coordination Assistance Information
descriptionList: The NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the gNB and used by the ng-eNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: NE-DC TDM Pattern
descriptionList: The NE-DC TDM Pattern IE is provided by the gNB and used by the ng-eNB to determine UL/DL reference configuration indicating the time during which a UE configured with NE-DC is allowed to transmit.

elementList.name: Subframe Assignment
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6)
elementList.description: Indicates DL/UL subframe configuration where sa0 points to Configuration 0, sa1 to Configuration 1 etc. as specified in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Harq Offset
elementList.description: Indicates a HARQ subframe offset that is applied to the subframes designated as UL in the associated subframe assignment, see TS 36.331 [14]

definitionList.name: Interface Instance Indication
descriptionList: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the XnAP message is destined for.
NOTE:	The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an Xn-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance.

definitionList.name: Configured TAC Indication
descriptionList: This IE indicates that in a NR cell served by the gNB, the TAC with which this IE is associated, is only configured but not broadcast.
NOTE:	This IE is defined in accordance to the possibility foreseen in TS 38.331 [10] to not broadcast the TAC if the NR cell only supports PSCell/SCell functionality.

definitionList.name: Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR
descriptionList: This IE contains the subcarrier spacing, cyclic prefix and TDD DL-UL slot configuration of an NR cell that a neighbour NG-RAN node needs to take into account for cross-link interference mitigation, and/or for NR-DC power coordination, when operating its own cells.

elementList.name: NR SCS
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (scs15, scs30, scs60, scs120, …, scs480, scs960)
elementList.description: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

elementList.name: NR Cyclic Prefix
elementList.description: The type of cyclic prefix, which determines the number of symbols in a slot.

elementList.name: NR DL-UL Transmission Periodicity
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (ms0p5, ms0p625, ms1, ms1p25, ms2, ms2p5, ms3, ms4, ms5, ms10, ms20, ms40, ms60, ms80, ms100, ms120, ms140, ms160, …)
elementList.description: The periodicity is expressed in the format msXpYZ, and equals X.YZ milliseconds.

elementList.name: Number of DL Symbols
elementList.description: Number of consecutive DL symbols in the slot identified by Slot Index. If extended cyclic prefix is used, the maximum value is 11. The Permutation IE indicates the location of DL symbols in the slot.

elementList.name: Number of UL Symbols
elementList.description: Number of consecutive UL symbols in the slot identified by Slot Index. If extended cyclic prefix is used, the maximum value is 11. The Permutation IE indicates the location of UL symbols in the slot.

elementList.name: Permutation
elementList.description: If not present, the default value is DFU.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum length of number of slots in a 10-ms period. Value is 5120.

definitionList.name: Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR
descriptionList: The Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about NR cells and it includes information about cell list size capacity.

definitionList.name: Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA
descriptionList: The Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about E-UTRA cells and it includes information about cell list size capacity.

definitionList.name: Cell Assistance Information E-UTRA
descriptionList: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about E-UTRA cells.

elementList.name: List of Requested E-UTRA Cells
elementList.description: Included when the NG-RAN node requests a limited list of served E-UTRA cells.

elementList.name: E-UTRA CGI
elementList.description: E-UTRA cell for which served E-UTRA cell information is requested.

elementList.name: Complete Information Request Indicator
elementList.description: Included when the NG-RAN node requests the complete list of served cells for a ng-eNB

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be served by a NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.

definitionList.name: Maximum Cell List Size
descriptionList: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given cell list.

definitionList.name: Message Oversize Notification
descriptionList: This IE indicates that a failure has occurred due to an excessive message size and it indicates the maximum number of cells that can be received in the List of Served Cells NR IE or in the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE.

definitionList.name: Partial List Indicator
descriptionList: The Partial List Indicator IE is used by the NG-RAN node to indicate whether the served cell information contained in the same message is a partial list.

definitionList.name: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN
descriptionList: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [25]).

elementList.name: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN

definitionList.name: NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset
descriptionList: This IE is used to indicate the offset between the UL carrier frequency center with respect to DL carrier frequency center.

elementList.name: NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset
elementList.description: Unit: kHz Corresponds to information provided in the TDD-UL-DL-AlignmentOffset-NB IE as specified in TS 36.331 [14].

definitionList.name: TNL Capacity Indicator
descriptionList: The TNL Capacity Indicator IE indicates the offered and available capacity of the Transport Network experienced by the NG RAN cell

elementList.name: DL TNL Offered Capacity
elementList.description: Maximum capacity offered by the transport portion of the cell in kbps

elementList.name: DL TNL Available Capacity
elementList.description: Available capacity over the transport portion serving the cell in percentage. Value 100 corresponds to the offered capacity.

elementList.name: UL TNL Offered Capacity
elementList.description: Maximum capacity offered by the transport portion of the cell in kbps

elementList.name: UL TNL Available Capacity
elementList.description: Available capacity over the transport portion serving the cell in percentage. Value 100 corresponds to the offered capacity.

definitionList.name: Radio Resource Status
descriptionList: The Radio Resource Status IE indicates the usage of the PRBs per cell for MIMO, per SSB area, and per slice for all traffic in Downlink and Uplink and the usage of PDCCH CCEs for Downlink and Uplink scheduling.

elementList.name: DL GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per cell DL GBR PRB usage

elementList.name: UL GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per cell UL GBR PRB usage

elementList.name: DL non-GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per cell DL non-GBR PRB usage

elementList.name: UL non-GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per cell UL non-GBR PRB usage

elementList.name: DL Total PRB usage
elementList.description: Per cell DL Total PRB usage

elementList.name: UL Total PRB usage
elementList.description: Per cell UL Total PRB usage

elementList.name: SSB Area Radio Resource Status List
SSB Area Radio Resource Status Item
SSB Area DL GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per SSB area DL GBR PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: SSB Area UL GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per SSB area UL GBR PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: SSB Area DL non-GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per SSB area DL non-GBR PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: SSB Area UL non-GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per SSB area UL non-GBR PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: SSB Area DL Total PRB usage
elementList.description: Per SSB area DL Total PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: SSB Area UL Total PRB usage
elementList.description: Per SSB area UL Total PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: Slice DL GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per slice DL GBR PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: Slice UL GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per slice UL GBR PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: Slice DL non-GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per slice DL non-GBR PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: Slice UL non-GBR PRB usage
elementList.description: Per slice UL non-GBR PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: Slice DL Total PRB allocation
elementList.description: Total amount of DL PRBs available per cell for the slice if all the resources the slice could access were usable.

elementList.name: Slice UL Total PRB allocation
elementList.description: Total amount of UL PRBs available per cell for the slice if all the resources the slice could access were usable.

elementList.name: DL GBR PRB usage for MIMO
elementList.description: Per cell DL GBR PRB usage for MIMO in percentage of the cell total PRB number as defined in TS 38.314 [42].

elementList.name: UL GBR PRB usage for MIMO
elementList.description: Per cell UL GBR PRB usage for MIMO in percentage of the cell total PRB number as defined in TS 38.314 [42].

elementList.name: DL non-GBR PRB usage for MIMO
elementList.description: Per cell DL non-GBR PRB usage for MIMO in percentage of the cell total PRB number as defined in TS 38.314 [42].

elementList.name: UL non-GBR PRB usage for MIMO
elementList.description: Per cell UL non-GBR PRB usage for MIMO in percentage of the cell total PRB number as defined in TS 38.314 [42].

elementList.name: DL Total PRB usage for MIMO
elementList.description: Per cell DL Total PRB usage for MIMO in percentage of the cell total PRB number as defined in TS 38.314 [42].

elementList.name: UL Total PRB usage for MIMO
elementList.description: Per cell UL Total PRB usage for MIMO in percentage of the cell total PRB number as defined in TS 38.314 [42].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. SSB Areas that can be served by a NG-RAN node cell. Value is 64.
Maximum no. of signalled slice support items. Value is 1024.
Maximum no. of broadcast PLMNs by a cell. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: Composite Available Capacity Group
descriptionList: The Composite Available Capacity Group IE indicates the overall available resource level per cell and per SSB area in the cell in Downlink, Uplink and Supplementary Uplink.

elementList.name: Composite Available Capacity Downlink
elementList.description: For the Downlink

elementList.name: Composite Available Capacity Uplink
elementList.description: For the Uplink, including both NUL and SUL (if available)

elementList.name: Composite Available Capacity Supplementary Uplink
