elementList.description: For the SUL

definitionList.name: Composite Available Capacity
descriptionList: The Composite Available Capacity IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in either Downlink or Uplink.

elementList.name: Capacity Value
elementList.description: ‘0’ indicates no resource is available, Measured on a linear scale.

definitionList.name: Cell Capacity Class Value
descriptionList: The Cell Capacity Class Value IE indicates the value that classifies the cell capacity with regards to the other cells. The Cell Capacity Class Value IE only indicates resources that are configured for traffic purposes.

elementList.name: Capacity Class Value
elementList.description: Value 1 indicates the minimum cell capacity, and 100 indicates the maximum cell capacity. There should be a linear relation between cell capacity and Cell Capacity Class Value.

definitionList.name: Capacity Value
descriptionList: The Capacity Value IE indicates the amount of resources per cell and per SSB area that are available relative to the total NG-RAN resources. The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum NG-RAN resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation. The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available.

elementList.name: Capacity Value
elementList.description: Value 0 indicates no available capacity, and 100 indicates maximum available capacity with respect to the whole cell. Capacity Value should be measured on a linear scale.

elementList.name: SSB Area Capacity Value
elementList.description: Value 0 indicates no available capacity, and 100 indicates maximum available capacity . SSB Area Capacity Value should be measured on a linear scale.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. SSB Areas that can be served by a NG-RAN node cell. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: Slice Available Capacity
descriptionList: The Slice Available Capacity IE indicates the amount of resources per network slice that are available per cell relative to the total NG-RAN resources per cell. The Slice Available Capacity Value Downlink IE and the Slice Available Capacity Value Uplink IE can be weighted according to the ratio of the corresponding cell capacity class values contained in the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if available.

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMN

elementList.name: Slice Available Capacity Value Downlink
elementList.description: Value 0 indicates no available capacity, and 100 indicates maximum available capacity . Slice Available Capacity Value Downlink should be measured on a linear scale.

elementList.name: Slice Available Capacity Value Uplink
elementList.description: Value 0 indicates no available capacity, and 100 indicates maximum available capacity. Slice Available Capacity Value Uplink should be measured on a linear scale.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of signalled slice support items. Value is 1024.
Maximum no. of PLMN Ids.broadcast in a cell. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: RRC Connections
descriptionList: The RRC Connections IE indicates the overall status of RRC connections per cell.

definitionList.name: Number of RRC Connections
descriptionList: The Number of RRC Connections IE indicates the maximum supported number of UEs in RRC_CONNECTED mode.

definitionList.name: Available RRC Connection Capacity Value
descriptionList: The Available RRC Connection Capacity Value IE indicates the residual percentage of the number of RRC connections, relative to the maximum number of RRC connections supported by the cell.

elementList.name: Available RRC Connection Capacity Value
elementList.description: Value 0 indicates no available capacity, and 100 indicates maximum available capacity with respect to the whole cell. Capacity Value should be measured on a linear scale.

definitionList.name: UE RLF Report
descriptionList: This IE contains the RLF Report to be transferred.

elementList.name: NR UE RLF Report Container
elementList.description: Includes the nr-RLF-Report contained in the UEInformationResponse message as defined in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: LTE UE RLF Report Container
elementList.description: Includes the rlf-Report-r9 contained in th\e UEInformationResponse message defined in TS 36.331 [14]

elementList.name: LTE UE RLF Report Container
elementList.description: Includes the rlf-Report-r9 contained in the UEInformationResponse message as defined in TS 36.331 [14]

elementList.name: LTE UE RLF Report Container Extend Band
elementList.description: Includes the rlf-Report-v9e0 contained in the UEInformationResponse message as defined in TS 36.331 [14]

definitionList.name: Mobility Parameters Information
descriptionList: The Mobility Parameters Information IE contains the change of the Handover Trigger as compared to its current value. The Handover Trigger corresponds to the threshold at which a cell initialises the handover preparation procedure towards a specific neighbour cell. Positive value of the change means the handover is proposed to take place later.

elementList.name: Handover Trigger Change
elementList.description: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

definitionList.name: Mobility Parameters Modification Range
descriptionList: The Mobility Parameters Modification Range IE contains the range of Handover Trigger Change values permitted by the NG-RAN node2 at the moment the MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message is sent.

elementList.name: Handover Trigger Change Lower Limit
elementList.description: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

elementList.name: Handover Trigger Change Upper Limit
elementList.description: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

definitionList.name: Number of Active UEs
descriptionList: The Number of Active UEs IE indicates the mean number of active UEs as defined in TS 38.314 [42].

elementList.name: Mean number of Active UEs
elementList.description: As defined in TS 38.314 [42] and where value "1" is equivalent to 0.1 Active UEs, value "2" is equivalent to 0.2 Active UEs, value n is equivalent to n/10 Active UEs.

definitionList.name: NR Carrier List
descriptionList: This IE indicates the SCS-specific carriers per TDD, per DL, per UL or per SUL of an NR cell.

elementList.name: NR SCS
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (scs15, scs30, scs60, scs120, …, scs480, scs960)
elementList.description: SCS for the corresponding carrier.

elementList.name: Offset to Carrier
elementList.description: Offset in frequency domain between Point A (lowest subcarrier of common RB 0) and the lowest usable subcarrier on this carrier in number of PRBs (using the NR SCS IE defined for this carrier). The maximum value corresponds to 275×8−1. See TS 38.211 [39], clause 4.4.2.

elementList.name: Carrier Bandwidth
elementList.description: Width of this carrier in number of PRBs (using the NR SCS IE defined for this carrier). See TS 38.211 [39], clause 4.4.2. For band n100 and specific GSCN values defined in Table 5.4.3.1-3 of TS 38.104 [24], the utilized transmission bandwidth is less than the maximum transmission bandwidth configuration NRB specified in Table 5.3.2-1 of TS 38.104 [24].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of SCS-specific carriers per TDD, per DL, per UL or per SUL of an NR cell. Value is 5.
Maximum no. of Physical Resource Blocks. Value is 275.

definitionList.name: SSB Positions In Burst
descriptionList: Indicates the time domain positions of the transmitted SS-blocks in a half frame with SS/PBCH blocks as defined in TS 38.213 [40], clause 4.1.

elementList.name: CHOICE ssb-PositionsInBurst
elementList.description: The first/ leftmost bit corresponds to SS/PBCH block index 0, the second bit corresponds to SS/PBCH block index 1, and so on. Value 0 in the bitmap indicates that the corresponding SS/PBCH block is not transmitted while value 1 indicates that the corresponding SS/PBCH block is transmitted.

definitionList.name: NID
descriptionList: This IE is used to identify (together with a PLMN identifier) a Standalone Non-Public Network. The NID is specified in TS 23.003 [22].

definitionList.name: CAG-Identifier
descriptionList: This IE is used to identify (together with a PLMN identifier) a Public Network Integrated Non-Public Network. The CAG-Identifier is specified in TS 23.003 [22].

definitionList.name: Broadcast NID List
descriptionList: This IE contains a list of NIDs.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of NIDs broadcast in a cell. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: Broadcast SNPN ID List
descriptionList: This IE contains a list of SNPN IDs.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of SNPN IDs broadcast in a cell. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: Broadcast CAG-Identifier List
descriptionList: This IE contains a list of CAG-Identifiers.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of CAG-Identifiers broadcast in a cell. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: Broadcast PNI-NPN ID Information
descriptionList: This IE contains a list of PNI-NPN IDs.

elementList.name: Broadcast PNI-NPN ID Information
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMNs

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of broadcast PLMNs by a cell. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: NPN Broadcast Information
descriptionList: This IE contains NPN related broadcast information.

elementList.name: CHOICE NPN Broadcast Information per PLMN

definitionList.name: NPN Support
descriptionList: This IE contains NPN related information associated with Network Slicing information.

elementList.name: NID
elementList.description: This IE is associated with the PLMN Identity and the TAI Slice Support List contained in the TAI Support List IE. Together with the PLMN Identity it identifiers the SNPN supported in the corresponding Tracking Area by the NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: Global Cell Identity
descriptionList: This IE is used to globally identify an NG-RAN cell or an E-UTRAN cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

elementList.name: E-UTRA Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identity IE value correspond to the eNB ID (defined in section 9.2.22 in TS 36.423 [44]).

definitionList.name: NPRACH Configuration
descriptionList: This IE indicates the NPRACH Configuration.

elementList.name: Anchor Carrier NPRACH Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the NPRACH-ParametersList-NB-r13 IE as defined in 6.7.3.2 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Anchor Carrier EDT NPRACH Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the NPRACH-ParametersList-NB-r14 IE as defined in 6.7.3.2 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Anchor Carrier Format 2 NPRACH Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the NPRACH-ParametersListFmt2-NB-r15 IE as defined in 6.7.3.2 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Anchor Carrier Format 2 EDT NPRACH Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the NPRACH-ParametersListFmt2-NB-r15 IE as defined in 6.7.3.2 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Non Anchor Carrier NPRACH Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the UL-ConfigCommonList-NB-r14 IE as defined in 6.7.3.1 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Non Anchor Carrier Format 2 NPRACH Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the UL-ConfigCommonList-NB-v1530 IE as defined in 6.7.3.1 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Anchor Carrier NPRACH Configuration TDD
elementList.description: Includes the NPRACH-ParametersListTDD-NB-r15 IE as defined in 6.7.3.2 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Non Anchor Carrier Frequency Configuration list
Non Anchor Carrier Frequency
elementList.description: Includes the DL-CarrierConfigCommon-NB-r14 IE as defined in 6.7.3.2 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Non Anchor Carrier NPRACH Configuration TDD
elementList.description: Includes the UL-ConfigCommonListTDD-NB-r15 IE as defined in 6.7.3.1 of TS 36.331 [14].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of non-Anchor Carrier Frequency Configurations. Value is 15.

definitionList.name: SFN Offset
descriptionList: This IE contains the time offset between an absolute time reference and the SFN0 start. The IE is calculated assuming that the SFN transmission started at the absolute time reference. The absolute time reference chosen is 1980-01-06 T00:00:19 International Atomic Time (TAI).

elementList.name: SFN Time Offset
elementList.description: Time offset in microseconds between the absolute time reference "1980-01-06 T00:00:19 International Atomic Time (TAI)” and the SFN0 start. The maximum usable value is (1024*10^4-1). Values higher than the maximum are discarded.

definitionList.name: CHO Configuration
descriptionList: This IE contains the CHO configuration information.

elementList.name: MeasObject Container
elementList.description: Includes the MeasObjectToAddMod IE contained in the RRCReconfiguration message (TS 38.331 [10]), which is configured for the CHO candidate cell

elementList.name: ReportConfig Container
elementList.description: Includes the ReportConfigToAddMod IE contained in the RRCReconfiguration message (TS 38.331 [10]), which is configured for the CHO candidate cell

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be prepared for a conditional handover. Value is 8.
Maximum no. execution conditions for a conditional handover. Value is 2.

definitionList.name: SSB Offset Information
descriptionList: This IE represents the SSB Offset to apply to UE measurements received for the SSB Area identified by the SSB Index.

definitionList.name: SSB Offset Modification Range
descriptionList: The SSB Offset Modification Range IE contains the range of SSB Offset values permitted by the NG-RAN node2 at the moment the MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message is sent.

definitionList.name: Multiplexing Info
descriptionList: This IE contains information about the multiplexing capabilities between the IAB-DU’s cell and the cells configured on the co-located IAB-MT.

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: Cell identity of a serving cell configured for a co-located IAB-MT.

elementList.name: DU_RX/MT_RX
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (supported, not supported, supported and FDM required, …)
elementList.description: An indication of whether the IAB-node supports simultaneous reception at its DU and MT side.

elementList.name: DU_TX/MT_TX
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (supported, not supported, supported and FDM required, …)
elementList.description: An indication of whether the IAB-node supports simultaneous transmission at its DU and MT side.

elementList.name: DU_TX/MT_RX
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (supported, not supported, supported and FDM required, …)
elementList.description: An indication of whether the IAB-node supports simultaneous transmission at its DU and reception at its MT side.

elementList.name: DU_RX/MT_TX
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (supported, not supported, supported and FDM required, …)
elementList.description: An indication of whether the IAB-node supports simultaneous reception at its DU and transmission at its MT side.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of serving cells for an IAB-MT. Value is 32, as defined by the maxNrofServingCells in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: Traffic Index
descriptionList: This IE is used to identify the traffic offloaded to the topology of non-F1-terminating IAB-donor. This IE is only applicable to IAB.

definitionList.name: Traffic Profile
descriptionList: This IE indicates the QoS parameters for F1-U traffic, or the non-UP traffic type. This IE is only applicable to IAB.

definitionList.name: F1-Terminating Topology BH Information
descriptionList: This IE provides the BH information of the traffic used in F1-terminating IAB-donor’s topology. This IE is only applicable to IAB.

elementList.name: DL F1 Terminating BH Info
elementList.description: This IE indicates the BH information for DL traffic of a descendant node.

elementList.name: UL F1 Terminating BH Info
elementList.description: This IE indicates the BH information for UL traffic of a descendant node.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of BH information corresponding to one Traffic Index assigned to the traffic offloaded to the non-F1-terminating IAB-donor. The value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Non-F1-terminating Topology BH Information
descriptionList: This IE provides the BH information of the traffic used in non-F1-terminating IAB-donor’s topology. This IE is only applicable to IAB.

elementList.name: DL Non-F1 Terminating BH Info
elementList.description: This IE indicates the BH information for DL traffic

elementList.name: UL Non-F1 Terminating BH Info
elementList.description: This IE indicates the BH information for UL traffic

elementList.name: BAP Control PDU RLC CH List
BAP Control PDU RLC CH Item IEs

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of BH information corresponding to one Traffic Index assigned to the traffic offloaded to the non-F1-terminating IAB-donor. The value is 1024.
Maximum no. of BH RLC CHs to be used for the boundary IAB-node and its parent node in the non-F1-terminating topology. The value is 2.

definitionList.name: Traffic To Be Released Information
descriptionList: This IE is used to indicate the offloaded traffic to be released. This IE is only applicable to IAB.

elementList.name: Traffic To Be Released Item IE

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of traffic offloaded to the non-F1-terminating IAB-donor. The value is 1024.

definitionList.name: IAB TNL Address Request
descriptionList: This IE indicates the request of IP address assignment, and/or the request of IP address removal. This IE is only applicable to IAB.

elementList.name: IAB TNL Address To Remove List
IAB TNL Address To Remove Item

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum total no. of IPv4 address(es), IPv6 address(es) and IPv6 address prefix(es) that can be requested in one procedure execution. The value is 1024.

definitionList.name: IAB TNL Address Response
descriptionList: This IE indicates the TNL address(es) assigned to IAB node(s).

elementList.name: IAB TNL Address Usage
elementList.description: Indicates the usage of the allocated IPv4 or IPv6 address or IPv6 address prefix.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum total no. of IPv4 address(es), IPv6 address(es) and IPv6 address prefix(es) that can be requested in one procedure execution. The value is 1024.

definitionList.name: BAP Routing ID
descriptionList: This IE indicates the BAP Routing ID. This IE is only applicable to IAB.

definitionList.name: BH RLC Channel ID
descriptionList: This IE uniquely identifies a BH RLC channel in the link between IAB-MT of the IAB-node and IAB-DU of the parent IAB-node or IAB-donor-DU.

definitionList.name: BAP Address
descriptionList: This IE indicates the BAP address of an IAB-node or of an IAB-donor-DU, and it is part of the BAP Routing ID.

elementList.name: BAP Address
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the bap-Address, defined in subclause 6.2.2 or subclause 6.3.2 of TS 38.331 [10], or the iab-donor-DU-BAP-Address defined in subclause 6.2.2 of TS 38.331[10].

definitionList.name: BAP Path ID
descriptionList: This IE indicates the BAP Path ID, which is part of the BAP Routing ID. This IE is only applicable to IAB.

elementList.name: BAP Path ID
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the bap-PathId defined in subclause 6.3.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: IAB QoS mapping information
descriptionList: This IE indicates the DSCP and/or IPv6 Flow Label field(s) of an IP packet of the traffic offloaded to the non-F1-terminating IAB-donor topology. This IE is only used for IAB.

definitionList.name: IAB TNL Address
descriptionList: This IE indicates an IPv4 or IPv6 address or an IPv6 address prefix assigned to an IAB-node.

elementList.name: IPv4 Address
elementList.description: The IPv4 address allocated to an IAB-node.

elementList.name: IPv6 Address
elementList.description: The IPv6 address allocated to an IAB-node.

elementList.name: IPv6 Prefix
elementList.description: The IPv6 address prefix allocated to an IAB-node.

definitionList.name: IAB TNL Addresses Requested
descriptionList: This IE indicates the number of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses or IPv6 address prefixes requested for the indicated usage.

elementList.name: TNL Addresses or Prefixes Requested - All Traffic
elementList.description: The number of TNL addresses/ IPv6 prefixes requested for all traffic.

elementList.name: TNL Addresses or Prefixes Requested - F1-C traffic
elementList.description: The number of TNL addresses/IPv6 prefixes requested for F1-C traffic.

elementList.name: TNL Addresses or Prefixes Requested - F1-U traffic
elementList.description: The number of TNL addresses/ IPv6 prefixes requested for F1-U traffic.

elementList.name: TNL Addresses or Prefixes Requested - Non-F1 traffic
elementList.description: The number of TNL addresses/ IPv6 prefixes requested for non-F1 traffic.

definitionList.name: IAB Cell Information
descriptionList: This IE contains IAB-DU cell resource configuration, cell specific signal/channel configuration and multiplexing info of the cell of an IAB-node or IAB-donor-DU.

elementList.name: gNB-DU Cell Resource Configuration-TDD
elementList.description: Contains TDD resource configuration of gNB-DU’s cell.

elementList.name: Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: gNB-DU Cell Resource Configuration-FDD-UL
elementList.description: Contains FDD UL resource configuration of gNB-DU’s cell.

elementList.name: gNB-DU Cell Resource Configuration-FDD-DL
elementList.description: Contains FDD DL resource configuration of gNB-DU’s cell.

elementList.name: UL Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the UL Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: DL Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the DL Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: IAB STC Info
elementList.description: STC configuration of this gNB-DU’s cell.

elementList.name: RACH Config Common
elementList.description: Includes the rach-ConfigCommon as defined in subclause 6.3.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: RACH Config Common IAB
elementList.description: Includes the IAB-specific rach-ConfigCommonIAB-r16 as defined in subclause 6.3.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: CSI-RS Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the NZP-CSI-RS-Resource IE as defined in subclause 6.3.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: SR Configuration
elementList.description: Includes the SchedulingRequestResourceConfig IE as defined in subclause 6.3.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: PDCCH Configuration SIB1
elementList.description: Includes the PDCCH-ConfigSIB1 IE as defined in subclause 6.3.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: SCS Common
elementList.description: Includes the subCarrierSpacingCommon as defined in subclause 6.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: Multiplexing Info
elementList.description: Contains information on multiplexing with cells configured for collocated IAB-MT, if applicable.

definitionList.name: gNB-DU Cell Resource Configuration
descriptionList: This IE contains the resource configuration of the cells served by a gNB-DU, i.e. the TDD/FDD resource parameters for each activated cell (TS 38.213 [40], clause 11.1.1). This IE is only applicable if the gNB-DU is an IAB-DU or an IAB-donor-DU.

elementList.name: Subcarrier Spacing
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (kHz15, kHz30, kHz120, kHz240, spare3, spare2, spare1, …, kHz60)
elementList.description: Subcarrier spacing used as reference for the TDD/FDD slot configuration.

elementList.name: DUF Transmission Periodicity
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (ms0p5, ms0p625, ms1, ms1p25, ms2, ms2p5, ms5, ms10, …)

elementList.name: DUF Slot Format Index
elementList.description: Index into Table 11.1.1-1 and Table 14-2 in TS 38.213 [40], excluding the last row in Table 14-2.

elementList.name: HSNA Transmission Periodicity
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (ms0p5, ms0p625, ms1, ms1p25, ms2, ms2p5, ms5, ms10, ms20, ms40, ms80, ms160, …)

elementList.name: HSNA Downlink
elementList.description: HSNA value for downlink symbols in a slot.

elementList.name: HSNA Uplink
elementList.description: HSNA value for uplink symbols in a slot.

elementList.name: HSNA Flexible
elementList.description: HSNA value for flexible symbols in a slot.

elementList.name: RB Set Configuration
elementList.description: Indicates the configuration for up to M non-overlapping RB sets for a given DU cell, used for frequency domain resource allocation. The maximum value of M is 8.

elementList.name: RB Set Index
elementList.description: Refers to an RB set defined by RB Set Configuration. The RB set indexes are consecutive (and increasing) starting at 0.

elementList.name: Slot Index
elementList.description: Index to a slot within the HSNA Transmission Periodicity. *

elementList.name: HSNA Downlink
elementList.description: HSNA value for downlink symbols in a slot, for an RB set.

elementList.name: HSNA Uplink
elementList.description: HSNA value for uplink symbols in a slot, for an RB set.

elementList.name: HSNA Flexible
elementList.description: HSNA value for flexible symbols in a slot, for an RB set.

elementList.name: NA cell resource configuration List
elementList.description: List of unavailable resources of this cell for the dual-connected boundary IAB-node.

elementList.name: NA Downlink
elementList.description: Indicates whether downlink symbols, in a slot, are unavailable to serve the boundary IAB-node.

elementList.name: NA Uplink
elementList.description: Indicates whether uplink symbols, in a slot, are unavailable to serve the boundary IAB-node.

elementList.name: NA Flexible
elementList.description: Indicates whether flexible symbols, in a slot, are unavailable to serve the boundary IAB-node.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of slots in 10ms. Value is 320. Corresponds to the maxNrofSlots defined in TS 38.331 [10].
Maximum no of "Hard", "Soft" or "Not available" slots in 160ms. Value is 5120.
Maximum no. of RB sets per DU cell. Value is 8.
Maximum no. of RB sets per DU cell minus 1. Value is 7.

definitionList.name: IAB STC Info
descriptionList: This IE contains cell SSB Transmission Configuration (STC) information of an IAB-DU or an IAB-donor-DU.

elementList.name: SSB Frequency Info
elementList.description: The SSB central frequency.

elementList.name: SSB Subcarrier Spacing
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (kHz15, kHz30, kHz120, kHz240, spare3, spare2, spare1, …)
elementList.description: The SSB subcarrier spacing.

elementList.name: SSB Transmission Periodicity
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (sf10, sf20, sf40, sf80, sf160, sf320, sf640, …, sf5)

elementList.name: SSB Transmission Timing Offset
elementList.description: SSB transmission timing offset in number of half-frames.

elementList.name: CHOICE SSB Transmission Bitmap
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the SSB-ToMeasure IE defined in TS 38.331 [10].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of STC configurations. Value is 5. This includes 1 STC configuration for access and 4 STC configurations for backhaul.
Maximum value of NR ARFCNs. Value is 3279165.

definitionList.name: RB Set Configuration
descriptionList: This IE contains the configuration for up to M non-overlapping RB sets for a given gNB-DU cell, used for frequency domain resource allocation. This IE is only applicable if the gNB-DU is an IAB-DU. The maximum value of M is 8.

elementList.name: Subcarrier Spacing
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (kHz15, kHz30, kHz120, kHz240, spare3, spare2, spare1, …, kHz60)
elementList.description: Subcarrier spacing used as reference for the RB set configuration.

elementList.name: RB Set Size
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (rb2, rb4, rb8, rb16, rb32, rb64)
elementList.description: Number of PRBs in each RB set. If the RB sets of IAB-DU H/S/NA resource configuration do not cover the entire carrier bandwidth, the remaining RBs not part of an RB set configuration are considered as included in the last RB set.

elementList.name: Number of RB Sets
elementList.description: Number of configured RB sets. The RB sets are contiguous and non-overlapping. If the NR Carrier List IE(9.2.2.63) is provided, the start RB index of the first RB set is the RB index of the lowest common RB with the SCS provided by RB Set Configuration IE, which overlaps with the lowest usable RB across all SCS-specific carriers provided by the NR Carrier List IE for the IAB-DU cell. Otherwise, the lowest subcarrier of the start RB of the first RB set is aligned with point A for the IAB-DU cell.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of RB sets per IAB-DU cell. Value is 8.

definitionList.name: IAB TNL Address Exception
descriptionList: This IE indicates the list of source TNL addresses carried on UL IP packets in an IAB network, which can be forwarded over the inter-IAB-donor-DU tunnel, and that are exempt from TNL address filtering, for the purpose of inter-donor-DU rerouting.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum total no. of IPv4 address(es), IPv6 address(es) and IPv6 address prefix(es) that can be requested in one procedure execution. The value is 1024.

definitionList.name: BH Info List
descriptionList: This IE indicates a list of BH information indices, where each index represents the offloaded traffic pertaining to, e.g., a certain BAP routing ID, BH RLC CH.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of BH information corresponding to one Traffic Index assigned to the traffic offloaded to the non-F1-terminating IAB-donor. The value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Non-UP traffic
descriptionList: This IE indicates the type of non-UP traffic.

elementList.name: Control Plane Traffic Type
elementList.description: Identified by the different codepoints in this IE, where 1 has the highest priority.

definitionList.name: Local NG-RAN Node Identifier
descriptionList: This IE is used to resolve a Global NG-RAN Node ID from an I-RNTI and obtain a reference to an UE context at RRC Resume.

elementList.name: Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Full I-RNTI profile 0
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Full I-RNTI profile 1
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Full I-RNTI profile 2
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Full I-RNTI profile 3
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Short I-RNTI profile 0
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Short I-RNTI profile 1
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Full I-RNTI profile 0
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Full I-RNTI profile 1
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Full I-RNTI profile 2
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Full I-RNTI profile 3
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Short I-RNTI profile 0
Local NG-RAN Node Identifier Short I-RNTI profile 1

definitionList.name: Served Cell Specific Info Request
descriptionList: The Served Cell Specific Info Request IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request specific information about NR cells.

elementList.name: List of Requested NR Cells
elementList.description: List of NR cells.

elementList.name: List of Requested NR Cells item
NR CGI
elementList.description: NR cell for which specific served NR cell information is requested.

elementList.name: Additional Measurement Timing Configuration List Request Indicator
elementList.description: Included when the NG-RAN node requests the Additional Measurement Timing Configuration List IE to be included in the Served Cell Information NR IE for the requested cells.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be served by a NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.

definitionList.name: CPAC Configuration
descriptionList: This IE contains the CPC or CPA configuration information.

elementList.name: MeasObject Container
elementList.description: Includes the MeasObjectToAddMod IE contained in the RRCReconfiguration message as specified in TS 38.331 [10], which is configured for the CPAC candidate cell

elementList.name: ReportConfig Container
elementList.description: Includes the ReportConfigToAddMod IE contained in the RRCReconfiguration message as specified in TS 38.331 [10], which is configured for the CPAC candidate cell

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. cells that can be prepared for a CPAC handover. Value is 8.
Maximum no. execution conditions for a conditional handover. Value is 2.

definitionList.name: Radio Resource Status NR-U
descriptionList: The Radio Resource Status NR-U IE indicates the usage of the PRBs per NR-U Channel for all traffic in Downlink and Uplink.

elementList.name: DL Total PRB Usage
elementList.description: Per NR-U Channel DL Total PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

elementList.name: UL Total PRB Usage
elementList.description: Per NR-U Channel UL Total PRB usage in percentage of the cell total PRB number.

definitionList.name: Mobile IAB Authorization Status
descriptionList: This IE indicates the authorization status of the mobile IAB-node.

definitionList.name: Mobile IAB Cell
descriptionList: This IE indicates that the cell is served by a mobile IAB-node.

definitionList.name: Message Type
descriptionList: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

elementList.name: Type of Message
elementList.type: CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

definitionList.name: Cause
descriptionList: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol.

elementList.name: Radio Network Layer Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice(s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice(s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context, CHO-CPC resources to be changed, RSN not available for the UP, NPN access denied, Report Characteristics Empty, Existing Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Measurement not Supported For The Object, UE Power Saving, Not existing NG-RAN node2 Measurement ID, Insufficient UE Capabilities, Normal Release, Value out of allowed range, SCG activation deactivation failure, SCG deactivation failure due to data transmission, SSB not Available, LTM Triggered, No Backhaul Resource, mIAB-node not authorized, IAB not Authorized)

elementList.name: Protocol Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)

elementList.name: Miscellaneous Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)

definitionList.name: Criticality Diagnostics
descriptionList: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

elementList.name: Procedure Code
elementList.description: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.

elementList.name: Triggering Message
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
elementList.description: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.

elementList.name: Procedure Criticality
elementList.description: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

elementList.name: IE Criticality
elementList.description: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.

elementList.name: IE ID
elementList.description: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of IE errors allowed to be reported with a single message. The Value is 256.

definitionList.name: Bit Rate
descriptionList: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL or by the UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate.
This IE also indicates the average UE Throughput.

elementList.name: Bit Rate
elementList.description: The unit is: bit/s

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters
descriptionList: This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be applied to a QoS flow.

elementList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
elementList.description: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Reflective QoS Attribute
elementList.description: Reflective QoS is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE applies to Non-GBR bearers only and is ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Additional QoS flow Information
elementList.description: If this IE is set to "more likely", this indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: QoS Monitoring Request
elementList.description: Indicates to measure UL, or DL, or both UL/DL delays for the associated QoS flow.

elementList.name: QoS Monitoring Reporting Frequency
elementList.description: Indicates the Reporting Frequency for RAN part delay for Qos monitoring. Unit: second

elementList.name: QoS Monitoring Disabled
elementList.description: Indicates to stop the QoS monitoring.

elementList.name: PDU Set QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Indicates the PDU Set QoS Parameters.

definitionList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
descriptionList: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Notification Control
elementList.description: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Alternative QoS Parameters Set List
elementList.description: Indicates alternative sets of QoS Parameters for the QoS flow.

definitionList.name: Allocation and Retention Priority
descriptionList: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Capability
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Vulnerability
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

definitionList.name: Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: CN Packet Delay Budget Downlink
elementList.description: Core Network Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE may be present in case of GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: CN Packet Delay Budget Uplink
elementList.description: Core Network Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE may be present in case of GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise.

definitionList.name: Dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE is ignored if the Extended Packet Delay Budget IE is present.

elementList.name: Packet Error Rate
elementList.description: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Delay Critical
elementList.description: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Extended Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: CN Packet Delay Budget Downlink
elementList.description: Core Network Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE may be present in case of GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: CN Packet Delay Budget Uplink
elementList.description: Core Network Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE may be present in case of GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise.

conditionList.explanation: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Identifier
descriptionList: This IE identifies either a QoS Flow within a PDU Session or an MBS QoS flow within an MBS Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: Packet Loss Rate
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

definitionList.name: Packet Delay Budget
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.

definitionList.name: Packet Error Rate
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Scalar
elementList.description: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.

definitionList.name: Averaging Window
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Unit: ms.

definitionList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Unit: byte,

definitionList.name: NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
descriptionList: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node.
The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2].

NOTE:	If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

definitionList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and a subscription parameter provided by the AMF to the NG-RAN.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction.

definitionList.name: PDU Session ID
descriptionList: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: PDU Session Type
descriptionList: This IE defines the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: TAI Support List
descriptionList: This IE indicates the list of TAIs supported by NG-RAN node and associated characteristics e.g. supported slices.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Broadcast TAC

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMN

elementList.name: TAI Slice Support List
elementList.description: Supported S-NSSAIs per TAC, per PLMN or per SNPN.

elementList.name: Extended TAI Slice Support List
elementList.description: Additional Supported S-NSSAIs per TAC, per PLMN or per SNPN.

elementList.name: TAI NSAG Support List
elementList.description: NSAG information associated with the slices per TAC, per PLMN or per SNPN.

elementList.name: TAI Slice Unavailable Cell List
elementList.description: Indicates the cells of the TAI configured with zero resources for a slice.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of TACs supported by an NG-RAN node. Value is 256.
Maximum no. of PLMNs supported by an NG-RAN node. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: S-NSSAI
descriptionList: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

definitionList.name: Slice Support List
descriptionList: This IE indicates the list of supported slices.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of signalled slice support items. Value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority
descriptionList: The Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE is used to define local configuration for RRM strategies such as camp priorities and control of inter-RAT/inter-frequency mobility in RRC_CONNECTED, as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: GUAMI
descriptionList: This IE contains the Globally Unique AMF Identifier (GUAMI) as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

definitionList.name: Target Cell Global ID
descriptionList: This IE contains either an NR CGI or an E-UTRA CGI.

definitionList.name: AMF UE NGAP ID
descriptionList: This IE is defined in TS 38.413 [5] and used to uniquely identify the UE association over the source side NG interface instance.

definitionList.name: SCG Configuration Query
descriptionList: The SCG Configuration Query IE is used to request the S-NG-RAN node to provide current SCG configuration.

definitionList.name: RLC Mode
descriptionList: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB.

definitionList.name: Transport Layer Address
descriptionList: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.

definitionList.name: UP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. When the NR-DC UE is connected with an IAB, the QoS Mapping Information is used to set the IP header of packets in case that the S-NG-RAN node serves the IAB and the packets belonging to MN-terminated split bearer/SCG bearer are transmitted from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node, and in case that the M-NG-RAN node serves the IAB and the packets belonging to SN-terminated split bearer/MCG bearer are transmitted from S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20].

elementList.name: GTP-TEID
elementList.description: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

definitionList.name: CP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn control plane transport.

definitionList.name: Masked IMEISV
descriptionList: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment.

elementList.name: Masked IMEISV
elementList.description: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [22] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1.

definitionList.name: DRB ID
descriptionList: This IE contains the DRB ID.

definitionList.name: DL Forwarding
descriptionList: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets.

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Accepted
descriptionList: This element indicates that data forwarding was accepted.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12
descriptionList: This information element indicates the 12-bit long PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bits long Hyper Frame Number.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
descriptionList: This information element indicates the 18-bit long PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 14 bits long Hyper Frame Number.

definitionList.name: RAN Paging Area
descriptionList: The RAN Paging Area IE defines the paging area within a PLMN for RAN paging a UE in RRC_INACTIVE state.

elementList.name: NG-RAN Cell Identity
elementList.description: In this version of the specification, the RAN paging area should contain NG-RAN cells of the same RAT type.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of cells in a RAN notification area. Value is 32.
Maximum no. of RAN area IDs in a RAN notification area. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: RAN Area ID
descriptionList: This IE defines the RAN Area ID.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

definitionList.name: UE Context ID
descriptionList: This IE is used to address a UE Context within an NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Allocated C-RNTI
elementList.description: Temporary C-RNTI or C-RNTI allocated to the UE by the cell where the RRC connection has been requested to be resumed, contained in the MAC RAR or MAC MSGB as defined in TS 38.321 [35] or in TS 36.321 [36].

elementList.name: Access PCI
elementList.description: The cell PCI where the RRC connection has been requested to be resumed.

elementList.name: C-RNTI
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided either in the c-RNTI contained in the RRCReestablishmentRequest message (TS 38.331 [10]) or in the RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message (TS 36.331 [14]).

definitionList.name: Assistance Data for RAN Paging
descriptionList: This IE provides assistance information for RAN paging.

definitionList.name: RAN Paging Attempt Information
descriptionList: This IE includes information related to the RAN paging attempt over Xn.

elementList.name: Paging Attempt Count
elementList.description: Number of the RAN paging attempt.

elementList.name: Intended Number of Paging Attempts
elementList.description: Intended number of RAN paging attempts.

elementList.name: Next Paging Area Scope
elementList.description: Indicates whether the RAN paging area scope will change at next RAN paging attempt.

definitionList.name: UE RAN Paging Identity
descriptionList: The IE defines the UE Identity for RAN paging a UE in RRC_INACTIVE.

definitionList.name: Paging Priority
descriptionList: This information element contains an indication of the priority to be considered for the paging request.

elementList.name: Paging Priority
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (PrioLevel1, PrioLevel2, PrioLevel3, PrioLevel4, PrioLevel5, PrioLevel6, PrioLevel7, PrioLevel8, ...)
elementList.description: Lower value codepoint indicates higher priority.

definitionList.name: Delivery Status
descriptionList: This IE provides the delivery status of RRC PDUs provided by RRC Transfer message.

elementList.name: Delivery Status
elementList.description: Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP SN, as defined in TS 38.323 [11].

definitionList.name: I-RNTI
descriptionList: The I-RNTI is defined for allocation in an NR or E-UTRA serving cell as a reference to a UE Context within an NG-RAN node. The I-RNTI is partitioned into two parts, the first part identifies the NG-RAN node that allocated the I-RNTI and the second part identifies the UE context stored in this NG-RAN node, refer to Annex C in TS 38.300 [9], or the I-RNTI is partitioned into three parts, the first part indicates the length of NG-RAN Node ID part of the NG-RAN Node that allocated the I-RNTI, the second part identifies the NG-RAN node that allocated the I-RNTI and the third part identifies the UE context stored in this NG-RAN node, refer to Annex F in TS 38.300[9].

elementList.name: I-RNTI full
elementList.description: This IE is used to identify the suspended UE context of a UE in RRC_INACTIVE using 40 bits and corresponds to information provided either in the I-RNTI-Value IE as defined in TS 38.331 [10] or in the I-RNTI IE as defined in TS 36.331 [14]).

elementList.name: I-RNTI short
elementList.description: This IE is used to identify the suspended UE context of a UE in RRC_INACTIVE using 24 bits and corresponds to information provided either in the ShortI-RNTI-Value IE as defined in TS 38.331 [10] or in the ShortI-RNTI IE as defined in TS 36.331 [14]).

definitionList.name: Location Reporting Information
descriptionList: This information element indicates how the location information should be reported.

elementList.name: Event Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED ( report upon change of serving cell, report UE moving presence into or out of the Area of Interest, …, report upon change of serving cell and Area of Interest)

definitionList.name: Area of Interest Information
descriptionList: This IE contains indicates the Area of Interest information, which may contain multiple Areas of Interest, as specified in TS 23.502 [13].

elementList.name: List of TAIs in Area of Interest
TAI in Area of Interest Item
List of Cells in Area of Interest
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined with SA2.

elementList.name: List of Global NG-RAN Nodes in Area of Interest
Global NG-RAN Node in Area of Interest Item

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of Areas of Interest. Value is 64.
Maximum no. of tracking areas in an Area of Interest. Value is 16.
Maximum no. of cells in an Area of Interest. Value is 256.
Maximum no. of global NG-RAN nodes in an Area of Interest. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: UE Security Capabilities
descriptionList: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE. Except as noted below, the NG-RAN nodes store and send the complete bitmaps without modification or truncation as specified in TS 38.300 [9].
NOTE:	There is a 1-bit circular shift between the bitmaps of the IE in this specification and the corresponding bitmaps in TS 38.413 [5].

elementList.name: NR Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, "second bit" – 128-NEA1, "third bit" – 128-NEA2, "fourth bit" – 128-NEA3, “fifth to eighth bit” correspond to bit 4 to bit 1 of octet 3 in the UE Security Capability IE defined in TS 24.501 [30], other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: NR Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, "second bit" – 128-NIA1, "third bit" – 128-NIA2, "fourth bit" – 128-NIA3, “fifth to eighth bit” correspond to bit 4 to bit 1 of octet 4 in the UE Security Capability IE defined in TS 24.501 [30], other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: E-UTRA Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0, "second bit" – 128-EEA1, "third bit" – 128-EEA2, "fourth bit" – 128-EEA3, “fifth to eighth bit” correspond to bit 4 to bit 1 of octet 5 in the UE Security Capability IE defined in TS 24.501 [30], other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

elementList.name: E-UTRA Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0, "second bit" – 128-EIA1, "third bit" – 128-EIA2, "fourth bit" – 128-EIA3, “fifth to eighth bit” correspond to bit 4 to bit 1 of octet 6 in the UE Security Capability IE defined in TS 24.501 [30], other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

definitionList.name: AS Security Information
descriptionList: The AS Security Information IE is used to generate the key material to be used for AS security with the UE.

elementList.name: Key NG-RAN Star
elementList.description: KNG-RAN* defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: Next Hop Chaining Count
elementList.description: Next Hop Chaining Count (NCC) defined in TS 33.501 [28]

definitionList.name: S-NG-RAN node Security Key
descriptionList: The S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE is used to apply security in the S-NG-RAN node as defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node Security Key
elementList.description: The S-KSN which is provided by the M-NG-RAN node, see TS 33.501 [28].

definitionList.name: Security Indication
descriptionList: This IE contains the user plane integrity protection indication and confidentiality protection indication which indicates the requirements on UP integrity protection and ciphering for the corresponding PDU session, respectively. Additionally, this IE contains the maximum integrity protected data rate values (UL and DL) per UE for integrity protected DRBs.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
elementList.description: If present, this IE contains the values received from the CN for the overall UE capability. This IE may be ignored by the SN in the case of dual connectivity.

conditionList.explanation: This IE shall be present if the Integrity Protection IE within the Security Indication IE is present and set to “required” or “preferred”.

definitionList.name: Mobility Restriction List
descriptionList: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility actions for which the NG-RAN provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation or for assigning proper RNAs. If the NG-RAN receives the Mobility Restriction List IE, it shall overwrite previously received restriction information. NG-RAN behaviour upon receiving this IE is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Equivalent PLMNs
elementList.description: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of "equivalent PLMNs" as defined in TS 24.501 [30]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the Serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

elementList.name: RAT Restrictions
elementList.description: This IE contains RAT restriction related information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: RAT Restriction Information
elementList.type: BIT STRING { e-UTRA (0), nR (1), nR-unlicensed (2), nR-LEO (3), nR-MEO (4), nR-GEO (5), nR-OTHERSAT (6)} (SIZE(8, …))
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bit 7 is reserved for future use.

elementList.name: Extended RAT Restriction Information
elementList.description: If this IE is included, the RAT Restriction Information IE is ignored.

elementList.name: Forbidden Area Information
elementList.description: This IE contains Forbidden Area information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the forbidden TAI.

elementList.name: Service Area Information
elementList.description: This IE contains Service Area Restriction information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the allowed TAI.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the not-allowed TAI.

elementList.name: Last E-UTRAN PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Indicates the E-UTRAN PLMN ID from where the UE formerly handed over to 5GS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to EPS.

elementList.name: Core Network Type Restriction for serving PLMN
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to EPC for the Serving PLMN as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Core Network Type Restriction for Equivalent PLMNs
PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Includes any of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which CN Type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Core Network Type Restriction
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to EPC or to 5GC for this PLMN.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of equivalent PLMNs. Value is 15.
Maximum no. of allowed PLMNs. Value is 16.
Maximum no. of forbidden Tracking Area Codes. Value is 4096.
Maximum no. of allowed or not allowed Tracking Areas. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Xn Benefit Value
descriptionList: The Xn Benefit Value IE indicates the quantified benefit of the signalling connection.

elementList.name: Xn Benefit Value
elementList.description: Value 1 indicates lowest benefit, and 8 indicates highest benefit.

definitionList.name: Trace Activation
descriptionList: This IE defines parameters related to a trace activation.

elementList.name: Interfaces To Trace
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an NG-RAN node interface: first bit = NG-C, second bit = Xn-C, third bit = Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1: other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.

elementList.name: Trace Depth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, …)
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [23].

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity IP Address
elementList.description: For File based Reporting. Defined in TS 32.422 [23] Should be ignored if the Trace Collection Entity URI IE is present.

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity URI
elementList.description: For Streaming based Reporting. Defined in TS 32.422 [23] Replaces Trace Collection Entity IP Address if present

elementList.name: MDT Configuration
elementList.description: This IE defines the MDT configuration parameters.

definitionList.name: Time To Wait
descriptionList: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting times.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Notification Control Indication Info
descriptionList: This IE provides information about QoS flows of a PDU Session Resource for which notification control has been requested.

elementList.name: Current QoS Parameters Set Index
elementList.reference: Alternative QoS Parameters Set Notify Index 9.2.3.104
elementList.description: Index to the currently fulfilled alternative QoS parameters set. Value 0 indicates that NG-RAN cannot even fulfil the lowest alternative parameter set.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of QoS flows allowed within one PDU session. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: Request Reporting Reference ID
descriptionList: This IE contains the Request Reporting Reference ID and is used for UE presence in Area of Interest reporting as specified in TS 23.502 [13].

definitionList.name: User plane traffic activity report
descriptionList: This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic activity.

elementList.name: User plane traffic activity report
elementList.description: "re-activated" is only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object

definitionList.name: Lower Layer presence status change
descriptionList: This IE is used to indicate that lower layer resources’ presence status shall be changed. If the presence status is set to "release lower layers" or "suspend lower layers", SDAP entities, PDCP entities, Xn-U bearer resources, NG-U bearer resources and UE context information shall be kept.

elementList.name: Lower Layer presence status change
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (release lower layers, re-establish lower layers, ..., suspend lower layers, resume lower layers)
elementList.description: "re-establish lower layers" is only set after "release lower layers" has been indicated. "resume lower layers" shall restore SCG. "resume lower layers" shall be only set after "suspend lower layers" has been indicated.

definitionList.name: RRC Resume Cause
descriptionList: The purpose of the RRC Resume Cause IE is to indicate to the old NG-RAN node the reason for the RRC Connection Resume as received from the UE in the resumeCause-r15 defined in TS 36.331 [14] or in the resumeCause defined in TS 38.331 [10]. In this version of the specification, this is limited to the case of RNA update.

definitionList.name: Priority Level
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

definitionList.name: PDCP SN Length
descriptionList: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer.

elementList.name: UL PDCP SN Length
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for UL.

elementList.name: DL PDCP SN Length
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for DL.

definitionList.name: UE History Information
descriptionList: The UE History Information IE contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in RRC_CONNECTED state prior to the target cell. The overall mechanism is described in TS 38.300 [9].
NOTE:	The definition of this IE is aligned with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 38.413 [5].

elementList.name: Last Visited Cell List
elementList.description: Most recent information is added to the top of this list

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum number of last visited cell information records that can be reported in the IE. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Last Visited Cell Information
descriptionList: The Last Visited Cell Information may contain cell specific information.

elementList.name: Last Visited NG-RAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 38.413 [5].

elementList.name: Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

elementList.name: Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 25.413 [32].

elementList.name: Last Visited GERAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

definitionList.name: Paging DRX
descriptionList: This IE indicates the RAN paging cycle as defined in TS 38.304 [33] and TS 36.304 [34].

elementList.name: Paging DRX
elementList.description: Unit is radio frame.

definitionList.name: Security Result
descriptionList: This IE indicates whether the security policy indicated as "preferred" in the Security Indication IE is performed or not.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

definitionList.name: UE Context Kept Indicator
descriptionList: This IE indicates whether the UE Context is kept at the S-NG-RAN node in case of an inter-M-NG-RAN node handover without S-NG-RAN node change or inter-M-NG-RAN node RRC resume without S-NG-RAN node change.

definitionList.name: PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList: This IE is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per PDU session which is defined for the downlink and the uplink direction and is provided at the Handover Preparation procedure to the target NG-RAN node and at the Retrieve UE Context procedure to the new NG-RAN node as received by the 5GC, during dual connectivity related procedures to the to the S-NG-RAN node as decided by the M-NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8].

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction.

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction.

definitionList.name: LCID
descriptionList: This IE uniquely identifies a logical channel ID for the associated DRB.

elementList.name: LCID
elementList.description: Corresponds to information provided in the LogicalChannelIdentity IE as defined in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: Duplication Activation
descriptionList: The Duplication Activation IE indicates the initial status of UL PDCP duplication, i.e., whether UL PDCP Duplication is activated or not.

definitionList.name: RRC Config Indication
descriptionList: This IE indicates the type of RRC configuration used at the S-NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
descriptionList: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

elementList.name: Maximum IP Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in UL. If the Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE is absent, this IE applies to both UL and DL.

elementList.name: Maximum IP Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in the DL.

definitionList.name: PDCP Change Indication
descriptionList: The PDCP Change Indication IE is used for S-NG-RAN node to either initiate the security key update or to request PDCP data recovery in M-NG-RAN node. The PDCP Change Indication IE is also used for M-NG-RAN node to request PDCP data recovery in S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Indication from S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (S-NG-RAN node key update required, PDCP data recovery required, ...)
elementList.description: S-NG-RAN node key update required indicates that the security key in S-NG-RAN node needs to be updated. The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the M-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.

elementList.name: Indication from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node
elementList.description: The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the S-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.

definitionList.name: UL Configuration
descriptionList: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the corresponding node.

elementList.name: UL UE Configuration
elementList.description: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the corresponding node.

definitionList.name: UP Transport Parameters
descriptionList: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB.

elementList.name: Cell Group ID
elementList.description: This IE corresponds to information provided in the CellGroupId IE as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values "2" and "3" shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no of Secondary Cell Groups. Value is 3.

definitionList.name: Desired Activity Notification Level
descriptionList: This IE contains information on which level activity notification shall be performed.

elementList.name: Desired Activity Notification Level
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (None, QoS Flow, PDU session, UE, …)

definitionList.name: Number of DRB IDs
descriptionList: This IE indicates the number of DRB IDs.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
descriptionList: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB.

elementList.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB

definitionList.name: RLC Status
descriptionList: The RLC Status IE indicates about the RLC configuration change included in the container towards the UE.

elementList.name: Reestablishment Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that following the change of the radio status, the RLC has been re-established.

definitionList.name: Expected UE Behaviour
descriptionList: This IE indicates the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the NG-RAN node in determining the optimum RRC connection time and to help with the RRC_INACTIVE state transition and RNA configuration (e.g. size and shape of the RNA).

elementList.name: Expected HO Interval
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (sec15, sec30, sec60, sec90, sec120, sec180, long-time, …)
elementList.description: Indicates the expected time interval between inter NG-RAN node handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter NG-RAN node handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.

elementList.name: Expected UE Mobility
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is expected to be stationary or mobile.

elementList.name: Expected UE Moving Trajectory
elementList.description: Indicates the UE's expected geographical movement.

elementList.name: Expected UE Moving Trajectory Item
elementList.description: Includes list of visited and non-visited cells, where visited cells are listed in the order the UE visited them with the most recent cell being the first in the list. Non-visited cells are included immediately after the visited cell they are associated with.

elementList.name: Time Stayed in Cell
elementList.description: Included for visited cells and indicates the time a UE stayed in a cell in seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095 seconds, this IE is set to 4095.
